entry.title: ÂºÄÂèëÊäÄÂ∑ßÊî∂Ëóè
entry.content:
Êî∂ÈõÜÂºÄÂèëÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑÊäÄÂ∑ßÔºåÊØîÂ¶Ç‰∏≠ÂõΩÈúÄË¶ÅÁöÑÈïúÂÉèÊúçÂä°Á≠â„ÄÇ

ÈïúÂÉèÊúçÂä°üîó

Githubüîó

  • Fastgit - Github ÂõΩÂÜÖÈïúÂÉè

  • Download: https://download.fastgit.org/org/repo/xxx

  • Clone git clone https://github.com/org/repo

  • Clone with ssh git clone git@ssh.fastgit.org:theowenyoung/gatsby-theme-primer-wiki.git

Rustüîó

  • rsproxy cn - rust ÂõΩÂÜÖÈïúÂÉè

Dockerüîó

  • ÈòøÈáå‰∫ëÂÖ¨ÁΩë: https://registry.cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com
  • ËÖæËÆØ‰∫ëÔºö https://mirror.ccs.tencentyun.com
    • ‰ΩøÁî®ËØ¥Êòé

sudo vim /etc/docker/daemon.json

{ "registry-mirrors": ["https://mirror.ccs.tencentyun.com"] }

sudo systemctl restart docker

Ëß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ°àüîó

  • ÈòøÈáå‰∫ëÂáΩÊï∞ËÆ°ÁÆó php ÁéØÂ¢ÉÂ¶Ç‰ΩïËá™ÂÆö‰πâÂÜÖÁΩÆÊâ©Â±ïÔºåË¶ÜÁõñÁ≥ªÁªüËá™Â∏¶Êâ©Â±ï

Bash Tipsüîó

Get bash script parent dir absolute pathüîó

workspace="$( cd -- "$( dirname -- "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )/../" &> /dev/null && pwd )"

Get bash script dir pathüîó

workspace="$( cd -- "$( dirname -- "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" &> /dev/null && pwd )"

Bash Dotenvüîó

ÂØºÂá∫.env Êñá‰ª∂Âà∞ÂΩìÂâçÊâßË°åÁéØÂ¢É

set -o allexport; source .env; set +o allexport

Deno Tipsüîó

Dirnameüîó

const __dirname = new URL(".", import.meta.url).pathname;

Docker Tipsüîó

Docker compose exec binüîó

docker-compose exec service-name /bin/sh

Stop All contains and removeüîó

sudo docker stop $(sudo docker ps -a -q)
sudo docker rm $(sudo docker ps -a -q)

Clean allüîó

sudo docker system prune --volumes
sudo docker image prune -a

Git Tipsüîó

Generate ssh keyüîó

Reference: Generating a new SSH key and adding it to the ssh-agent - GitHub Docs

ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "your_email@example.com"
# Start the ssh-agent in the background.
eval "$(ssh-agent -s)"
# Add your SSH private key to the ssh-agent
ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_ed25519

Add ssh key to Github:

cat .ssh/id_ed25519.pub

SSH Keys Setting

Ëé∑ÂèñÈ¶ñÊ¨°Êèê‰∫§Êó∂Èó¥üîó

  • Finding the date/time a file was first added to a Git repository - Stack Overflow - Ëé∑ÂèñÈ¶ñÊ¨°Êèê‰∫§Êó∂Èó¥

Êèê‰∫§Ê∂àÊÅØÁöÑÊ®°Áâàüîó

  • Git Semantic Commit Messages - git ËØ≠‰πâÂåñÊèê‰∫§Ê∂àÊÅØÊ®°Áâà

ÂêàÂπ∂‰∏äÊ∏∏ÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄô‰∏çÂºπÂá∫Á°ÆËÆ§Ê°Üüîó

git pull upstream main --commit --no-edit

ÂØπÊâÄÊúâÁöÑÂÜ≤Á™Å‰∏äÊ∏∏ÁöÑÊõ¥Êñ∞üîó

git checkout --theirs .

È¶ñÊ¨°Êõ¥Êñ∞Â≠ê repo submoduleüîó

git submodule update --init --recursive

Later

git submodule update --recursive

Gitignore ÂøΩÁï•ÊâÄÊúâÔºåÈô§‰∫ÜÊñá‰ª∂Â§πüîó

folder/*
!folder/.gitkeep

Go Template Tipsüîó

  • Parent Variable, {{$.XX}}
  • URL encode, urlquery "https://test.com"

ÂºÄÊ∫êËÆ∏ÂèØËØÅüîó

By Â¶Ç‰ΩïÈÄâÊã©ÂºÄÊ∫êËÆ∏ÂèØËØÅÔºü

Linux Common Commandsüîó

View current system infoüîó

lsb_release -a

Output:

Distributor ID:	Debian
Description:	Debian GNU/Linux 10 (buster)
Release:	10
Codename:	buster

View all usersüîó

cat /etc/passwd | grep -v nologin|grep -v halt|grep -v shutdown|awk -F":" '{ print $1"|"$3"|"$4 }'|more

Get Publish IPüîó

hostname -I

Change user groupüîó

usermod -g groupname username

Get user groupüîó

id -g -n

Remove apt ppaüîó

sudo add-apt-repository --remove ppa:qbittorrent-team/qbittorrent-stable

Get current shellüîó

echo "$SHELL"

Get current cpu archüîó

arch

or

dpkg --print-architecture

Unzip tar.gzüîó

tar -xf x.tar.gz

See also here

Tar to specific directory

tar -xf x.tar.gz -C ./xxx

Unzip .gzüîó

gzip -d file.gz

Stdout to Fileüîó

command &> file

Overwrite:

command >| file.txt 2>&1

Download/Upload file by SSH SCPüîó

Download to local:

scp root@ip:/path ~/Downloads

Remove node_modulesüîó

find . -name 'node_modules' -type d -prune -exec rm -rf '{}' +

Remove targetüîó

find . -name 'target' -type d -prune -exec rm -rf '{}' +

Find and replace stringüîó

sed -i 's/old-text/new-text/g' input.txt

Soft Linküîó

ln -s source_file target_file

Create Userüîó

useradd -m USERNAME

Note: with home directory

Get all shellsüîó

cat /etc/shells

Last n lines in fileüîó

tail -3 file.txt

Linux find a biggest directory in ./üîó

sudo du -a ./ 2>/dev/null | sort -n -r | head -n 20

Linux find a biggest file in ./üîó

find ./ -type f -printf '%s %p\n' | sort -nr | head -10

Linux view systemctl log:üîó

sudo journalctl -f -u service-name.service

See who connect with Meüîó

See: here

ss -tun state connected

Sort by ip connect with 443üîó

netstat -tn 2>/dev/null | grep -E '\s[0-9.]+:443\s' | awk '{print $5}' | cut -d : -f 1 | sort | uniq -c | sort -nr

Banüîó

See here

sudo systemctl status firewalld
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-rich-rule="rule family='ipv4' source address='202.61.254.136' reject"
sudo firewall-cmd --reload
sudo firewall-cmd --list-all

Kill tcpüîó

tcpkill host <ip>

Nodejs Tipsüîó

Delete node_modules folder recursively from a specified path using command lineüîó

Delete node_modules folder recursively from a specified path using command line - Stack Overflow

find . -name 'node_modules' -type d -prune -exec rm -rf '{}' +

Get NPM Tokenüîó

npm token create

Check NPM modules updatesüîó

npx npm-check-updates

Update to the latest version:

npx npm-check-updates -u

Postgresql Tipsüîó

0. Enter psqlüîó

psql

Show all databasesüîó

\l

Enter Databaseüîó

\c database_name

Show all Tablesüîó

\d

Show Table structureüîó

\d table_name

Pretty print tableüîó

\x on

Alter tableüîó

See https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/sql-altertable.html

Upsertüîó

See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/61494958/postgres-on-conflict-do-update-only-non-null-values-in-python

Export Schemaüîó

 pg_dump database_name -s --no-owner > schema.sql

Export Only dataüîó

 pg_dump database_name -a --no-owner > data.sql

Delete or Drop or Remove Databaseüîó

psql
drop database database_name;

Create Databaseüîó

psql
CREATE DATABASE name;

Import Databaseüîó

psql database_name < data.sql

CSSüîó

Smart word break in CSSüîó

From Smarter word break in CSS? - Stack Overflow

body {
  overflow-wrap: break-word;
  word-wrap: break-word;
  -ms-word-break: break-all;
  word-break: break-word;
  -ms-hyphens: auto;
  -moz-hyphens: auto;
  -webkit-hyphens: auto;
  hyphens: auto;
}

Vim Tipsüîó

Resourcesüîó

  • Vim online exercises - help you master vim with interactive exercises.

Tipsüîó

  • Delete all words: 1,$d

  • Current line end: $

  • Replace all string: s/string/replace_string/g

VS Code Tipsüîó

Open command palette: ‚áß‚åòPüîó

Select current line: cmd+Lüîó

Quick Switch Windowsüîó

Also see here

Added the following shortcut to keybindings.json

{
  "key": "alt+tab",
  "command": "workbench.action.quickSwitchWindow"
}

Read more:üîó

  • Visual Studio Code Tips and Tricks
  • GitHub - microsoft/vscode-tips-and-tricks: Collection of helpful tips and tricks for VS Code.

entry.title: RustÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑËµÑÊ∫ê
entry.content:
Curating awesome rust resources.

Resourcesüîó

  • Easy Rust - A book that let you learn rust easy, rust explained using easy English, for non-English native.
    • ‰∏≠ÊñáÁâà
  • rustlings - ü¶Ä Small exercises to get you used to reading and writing Rust code!
    • Learning Rust by Working Through the Rustlings Exercises
  • GitHub - Mercateo/rust-for-node-developers: An introduction to the Rust programming language for Node developers.
  • Rust by Example
  • rust-learning - A bunch of links to blog posts, articles, videos, etc for learning Rust
  • rust cookbook - This Rust Cookbook is a collection of simple Rust examples that demonstrate good practices to accomplish common programming tasks, using the crates of the Rust ecosystem.
  • Rust Design Patterns - A catalogue of Rust design patterns, anti-patterns and idioms
  • Microsoft Rust First Class
    • ‰∏≠ÊñáÁâà
  • awesome-alternatives-in-rust - A curated list of replacements for existing software written in Rust
  • Rust Language Cheat Sheet
  • Rust Latam: learn procedural macros workshop
  • Native Rust support on Cloudflare Workers
  • rust error handling
  • actix examples
  • Rust Á®ãÂ∫èËÆæËÆ°ËØ≠Ë®Ä‰∏≠ÊñáÁâà
  • rust web framework comparison
  • ÂçäÂ∞èÊó∂Â≠¶‰π† Rust

Answeresüîó

  • „ÄêÁøªËØë„Äë Rust ‰∏≠ÁöÑ String Âíå&str
  • „ÄêÁøªËØë„ÄëÁªÜË∞à Rust ÁöÑÊâÄÊúâÊùÉ
  • „ÄêËØë„ÄëRust ÂÆèÔºöÊïôÁ®ã‰∏éÁ§∫‰æãÔºà‰∫åÔºâ
  • Â¶Ç‰ΩïÂêàÂπ∂ error
  • rust ÈÖçÁΩÆÊñá‰ª∂ÊåáÂçó
  • rust mongodb redis example
  • rust sqlx postgres custom type
  • rust jwt example
  • tokio service Ëß£Êûê
    • ‰∏≠ÊñáÁâà
  • ÂÖ≥‰∫é rust ÁöÑÂ∏∏ËßÅÁñëÈóÆ‰∏≠ÊñáÁâà
  • 100 Ë°åÂÆûÁé∞ rust ÈùôÊÄÅÁΩëÁ´ôÁîüÊàê

Communitiesüîó

  • Rust Reddit

Toolsüîó

  • cargo-generate - cargo, make me a project
  • wasm-pack - your favorite rust -> wasm workflow tool!
  • gitoxide - Git in Rust
  • Cargo Watch - Cargo watch, hot reload rust.
  • Cargo Make - Rust task runner and build tool.
  • roapi - Create full-fledged APIs for static datasets without writing a single line of code.
  • binserve - A blazingly fast static web server with routing, templating, and security in a single binary you can set up with zero code. ‚ö°ü¶Ä
  • Create rust app

Librariesüîó

  • bevy - Ê∏∏ÊàèÂºïÊìé

  • tokio - A runtime for writing reliable, asynchronous, and slim applications with the Rust programming language

  • Rocket - A web framework for Rust.

  • axum - web framework

  • A data-first Rust-native UI toolkit. Druid - A data-first Rust-native UI design toolkit.

  • cratetorrent - A BitTorrent V1 engine library for Rust (and currently Linux) #Torrents

  • egui - GUI library in Rust

  • structopt - Parse command line arguments by defining a struct. It combines clap with custom derive.

  • telegram-bot - Rust Library for creating a Telegram Bot

  • anyhow - General error handle

  • thiserror - Specific error handle

  • frankenstein - telegram bot api

  • config-rs - Default config for rs

  • ssr-rs - rust ssr with js

  • sycamore - A reactive library for creating web apps in Rust and WebAssembly

  • percy - Build frontend browser apps with Rust + WebAssembly. Supports server side rendering.

  • actix-web - Actix Web is a powerful, pragmatic, and extremely fast web framework for Rust.

  • env-logger - log for rust

  • fluent-rs - rust i18n

    • handlebars-fluent

  • handlebars-rust

    • handlebars_misc_helpers

  • glob - Support for matching file paths against Unix shell style patterns.

  • walkdir - Rust library for walking directories recursively.

  • askama - type safe template engine

  • ramhorns - Fast Mustache template engine implementation in pure Rust.

  • sqlx - üß∞ The Rust SQL Toolkit. An async, pure Rust SQL crate featuring compile-time checked queries without a DSL. Supports PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, and MSSQL.

  • couch-rs - CouchDB library for Rust

  • sled - the champagne of beta embedded databases, redis alternatives

  • rksuid - Rust implementation of Segment.io‚Äôs ksuid, id generator.

    • sonyflake-rs - sony flake id generator rust
    • ulid-rs

  • diesel - database orm

  • rust juniper - graphql in rust

  • include_dir - compile include dir files

  • jwt-simple

  • pasetors

  • validator

  • axum - Ergonomic and modular web framework built with Tokio, Tower, and Hyper

  • once cell - Rust library for single assignment cells and lazy statics without macros

  • semver - Semantic versioning and version ranges for Rust

  • derivative - A set of alternative derive attributes for Rust

  • bs62 - rust 62 radix frome number

  • serde_with - serde with integligent convert

  • dialoguer - Rust utility library for nice command line prompts and similar things

  • rumqtt - rust mqtt broker

  • coreutils - linux core utils in rust

Projectsüîó

  • rusoto - aws sdk
    • aws-sign-v4

Applicationsüîó

  • ttyper - Terminal-based typing test.

  • rust full stack

Jobsüîó

Real world exampleüîó

  • lemmy - üêÄ Building a federated alternative to reddit in rust

  • revolt - discord alternative

Templatesüîó
